page.title: 10THE WOMAN (POEM)
page.content: {There she is again,}woman of 25 with the face of a forty year old. Battling with her three young screaming kids all stuck up in play school dirt. She drags them along, her face twisted with the pain and self sacrifice of bringing up a trio of kids. She lives a dog's life. Doing the housework-seeing the kids off to school-going to work-picking up the kids-making the tea-forcing them off to bed...... The same routine day after day, week after week after week, leaving her for bed shattered, dreading the next hectic day. It's not easy since he left. No more of life's little luxuries, not knowing where the next meal is coming from. Impossible children! A hell of a life!
